text.p: These are some of the leading stories in the official Vietnamese press on Friday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.

-- The Chairman of Credit Agricole Indosuez, Christian Maurin, told Deputy Prime Minister Phan Van Khai on Wednesday that his bank was committed to developing its activities in Vietnam and helping both domestic and foreign clients.
-- Out of more than 1,000 people admitted to hospital for food poisoning in the first five months of this year, 10 died.
-- Vietnam will export a record 3.5-4.0 million tonnes of rice this year, according to a Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Development forecast.
-- The government is aiming to disburse 12-15 percent of committed official development assistance (ODA) in the second half of this year.

-- Vietnam would be ready to share experience and send experts to help Burkina Faso, especially with agricultural output, Prime Minister Vo Van Kiet told visiting Foreign Minister Ablasse Ouedraogo on Thursday.
-- President Le Duc Anh sent congratulations to U.S. President Bill Clinton on the occassion of American Independence Day.
-- Prime Minister Vo Van Kiet told Autralian Foreign Minister Alexander Downer on Thursday that Vietnam wanted help from Australia in capital, technical know-how, technology and experience.
-- The value of Vietnam's industrial production in the first six months of this year was 62.56 trillion dong ($5.36 billion), up 13.59 percent from the same period last year.
-- Ho Chi Minh City's tax and capital control branches and city departments will tighten the financial management of enterprises.
